waddington.kai.main.knnf

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • waddington.kai.main.knnf.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The facade to the KNNF library/package. This class serves as a way for a user to use the neural network package simply. This class also orchestrates the training/testing loops.

    • Method Detail

      • addConv

        public void addConv(int numFilters,
                    int filterSize,
                    int stride,
                    java.lang.String activation)
        Public method to add a convolution layer to a network. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.
        Parameters:
        numFilters - The number of filters the convolution layer should contain.
        filterSize - The size of the receptive field for all filters in the layer. This sets both the X and Y dimensions.
        stride - The stride that the convolution layer should use.
        activation - The LayerActivation that the layer should use.

      • addFC

        public void addFC(int numberOfNeurons,
                  java.lang.String activation)
        Public method to add a fully-connected layer to a network. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.
        Parameters:
        numberOfNeurons - The number of neurons that the fully-connected layer should contain.
        activation - The activation type - LayerActivation - that this layer should use.

      • addFlatten

        public void addFlatten()
        Public method to add a flattening layer to a network. This is a required layer between multidimensional layers and single dimension layers. Must come before the first fully-connected layer. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.

      • addInput

        public void addInput(int imgWidth,
                     int imgHeight,
                     int imgChannels)
        Public method to add the input layer to a network. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.
        Parameters:
        imgWidth - The width of the input images.
        imgHeight - The height of the input images.
        imgChannels - The number of channels in the input images.

      • addLayer

        private void addLayer(Layer layer)
        Method used to add a Layer instance to the network. The public methods to add a layer to the network call this method passing a Layer instance that LayerFactory provides. This adds the layer to the list of layers in the network (networkLayers).
        Parameters:
        layer - A Layer instance to add to the network.

      • addOutput

        public void addOutput(int numberOfOutputs)
        Public method to add the output layer to a network. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.
        Parameters:
        numberOfOutputs - The number of output classes for the data-set. This defines the number of neurons in the layer.

      • addPool

        public void addPool(int poolSize,
                    int stride,
                    java.lang.String poolType)
        Public method to add a pooling layer to a network. Uses LayerFactory to create the layer.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - The size of the receptive field for the pooling layer. This sets both the X and Y dimensions.
        stride - The stride that the pool layer should use.
        poolType - The type of pool operation. LayerType.minPool or LayerType.maxPool.

      • checkDataSizes

        private void checkDataSizes()
        This is a part of the network validity check. This double checks that there are no negative values for layer output data sizes.

      • checkLayerOrders

        private void checkLayerOrders()
        Checks that the layers in the network are in a valid order. Called by networkValidityCheck(). Uses the LayerOrder data structure. This loops through all of the layers in the network and checks that all the layers directly before each layer are valid precedents to that layer. This also checks that the first and last layers are input and output layers.

      • checkShouldTerminate

        private boolean checkShouldTerminate(long startTime,
                                     int currentEpoch,
                                     double currentError)
        Checks whether the network should terminate the training.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The time that the network started training.
        currentEpoch - The current training epoch.
        currentError - The current error of the network.
        Returns:
        True if the network should terminate training, false otherwise.

      • checkTerminationConditionExists

        private void checkTerminationConditionExists()
        Checks that the user set a termination condition so that the network doesn't get stuck in an endless training loop.

      • convertLabelToInt

        private int convertLabelToInt(java.lang.String labelStr)
        Takes the String version of a class and converts it to an integer representation. This will change in the future to be more customisable.
        Parameters:
        labelStr - The String version of the class.
        Returns:
        An int representation of the class.

      • extractPrediction

        private java.lang.String extractPrediction(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix outputs,
                                           boolean printOutputs)
        Uses the outputs from the network to create a prediction.
        Parameters:
        outputs - The outputs from the network.
        printOutputs - A flag whether to print the outputs to the console. In the future this will change to use a logging facade.
        Returns:
        A String version of the predicted class if found, -1 otherwise.

      • getLayerInputSize

        public static int[] getLayerInputSize(int layerId)
        Gets the shape of the input to a specified layer.
        Parameters:
        layerId - The ID of the layer that you wish to find the input shape for.
        Returns:
        An int[] containing the {Z,Y,X} dimensions of the input data to the specified layer.

      • getLayers

        public java.util.List<Layer> getLayers()
        Used to get the list of layers in the network.
        Returns:
        The list of layers in the network - networkLayers.

      • getNumberOfNeuronsToLayer

        public static int getNumberOfNeuronsToLayer(int layerId)
        Gets the number of neurons in the layer before the specified layer.
        Parameters:
        layerId - The layer that you wish to find the number of neurons leading into.
        Returns:
        The number of neurons in the layer before the specified layer.

      • initErrorLogging

        private void initErrorLogging()
        Sets up the file for and writes the first line to the error logging file.

      • logError

        private void logError(double mse,
                      int epoch,
                      int example)
        Adds a line to the error log.
        Parameters:
        mse - The network error (MSE).
        epoch - The current training epoch.
        example - The training example number.

      • networkValidityCheck

        public void networkValidityCheck()
        Checks that the network is valid. This method must be called before training/testing/predicting. It checks that the layers are in a valid order and that the data sizes are also valid, however, it shouldn't be possible to reach this stage if the data sizes are not valid.

      • retrieveImageData

        private java.util.List<org.jblas.DoubleMatrix> retrieveImageData(java.lang.String trainingDir,
                                                                 java.lang.String imgName)
        Converts a .png image to a list of DoubleMatrix's containing the pixel values. The method for retrieving the image data is taken from 2 answers on stackoverflow: - https://stackoverflow.com/a/9470843/3259361 - https://stackoverflow.com/a/10089030/3259361
        Parameters:
        trainingDir - The directory containing the images.
        imgName - The name of the image (without extension).
        Returns:
        A list containing DoubleMatrix's containing the pixel values.

      • saveNetwork

        private void saveNetwork()
        Starts the process of saving a network model.

      • saveTestResults

        private void saveTestResults(java.lang.String[] predicted,
                             double[] errors)
        Save the results from testing to a file in the "./performance-logging/" directory. The directory will be customisable in the future.
        Parameters:
        predicted - The predictions that the model made.
        errors - The errors that the model produced.

      • setLayers

        public void setLayers(java.util.List<Layer> layers)
        Method used to set the layers of a network to an already existing list of layers.
        Parameters:
        layers - A list containing instances of a Layer class.

      • setLearningRate

        public void setLearningRate(float learningRate)
        Sets the learning rate of the network.
        Parameters:
        learningRate - The value for the learning rate.

      • setMaximumInitialWeights

        public void setMaximumInitialWeights(float maxInitialWeights)
        Sets the maximum distance from zero creating the range that weights can be initialised within. If set to 0.1, then the range that weights can be is [-0.1, 0.1].
        Parameters:
        maxInitialWeights - The absolute value for the range of weights.

      • setMomentum

        public void setMomentum(float momentum)
        Sets the momentum of the network.
        Parameters:
        momentum - The value for the momentum.

      • setPredictionData

        public void setPredictionData(java.lang.String predictionDir)
        Sets the prediction data. The .csv file must be named "testImages.csv" although this will be changeable in the future.
        Parameters:
        predictionDir - The directory containing the training data.

      • setTerminationConditions

        public void setTerminationConditions(int epoch,
                                     int error,
                                     long duration)
        Sets the training termination conditions. 1 of these must be set before training.
        Parameters:
        epoch - The number of epochs you wish to train for. -1 to not use this parameter.
        error - The minimum error you want to train to. -1 to not use this parameter.
        duration - The duration (ms) you want to train for. -1 to not use this parameter.

      • setTestingData

        public void setTestingData(java.lang.String testingDir)
        Sets the testing data. The .csv file must be named "testImages.csv" although this will be changeable in the future.
        Parameters:
        testingDir - The directory containing the training data.

      • setTrainingData

        public void setTrainingData(java.lang.String trainingDir)
        Sets the training data. The .csv file must be named "trainingImages.csv" although this will be changeable in the future.
        Parameters:
        trainingDir - The directory containing the training data.

      • startPredicting

        public void startPredicting(java.lang.String predictionDir)
        Orchestrates the network to make predictions on images.
        Parameters:
        predictionDir - The directory containing the images to make predictions on.

      • startTesting

        public void startTesting(java.lang.String testingDir)
        This method orchestrates the testing of the network. It receives a directory containing the testing images.
        Parameters:
        testingDir - The directory containing the testing images.

      • startTraining

        public void startTraining(java.lang.String trainingDir)
        This method orchestrates the training of the network. It receives a directory containing the training images.
        Parameters:
        trainingDir - The directory containing the training images.
